02 n. 01   ]πόλεμον[ res ed. pr. : ]πoλεμο̅[ P
author: anon.
statepreservation: single papyrus fragment (2.8 x 3.9 cm), broken off on all sides except for the bottom, where the original lower margin (about 1 cm) seems to be preserved. written on both sides by the same hand; recto: scanty remains of a first line, followed by a blank space and the remnants of 3 other lines of common words, probably belonging to a column of glosses to Ilias 11. verso: remnants of 6 lines with words from Ilias 11, arranged in a column as lemmata.
lectionalsigns: one abbreviation (recto, l. 2: final ? marked as a horizontal stroke on the last vowel); one high stop (recto, l. 3).
hand: elegant bookhand of mixed type, with contrast between thin and thick strokes and between narrow (especially ? and ?) and broad letters (especially ? and ?), written with care, medium-sized, slightly leaning forward, rougly bilinear with tiny ? depending from the upper line and small ? reaching below the lower line, the two semicircles of ? are at the bottom reduced to a single horizontal stroke, letters well separated
